title: Make Jackfruit Seed Fry Recipe | Crispy & Easy Vegan Dish
instructions: Take the jackfruit seeds and boil them in water for 10 minutes. Now, let the jackfruit seeds to go room temperature. Then, cut them into half and peel off the skin. Add turmeric powder and salt. Mix them well. Heat the oil and fry jackfruit seeds until they start to turn golden. For me, it takes about 5 minutes under high flame. Finally, add some chili powder and mix well till all are combined. This is how to make the best Sri Lankan jackfruit seeds fry recipe at home. Serve and enjoy these deep-fried crispy and spicy jackfruit seeds.
ingredients: Jackfruit Seeds - 250g | Turmeric Powder - ½ teaspoon | Red Chili Powder - ½ teaspoon | Salt - As you want | Cooking Oil - As you want
ingredients_per_person: Jackfruit Seeds - 125g | Turmeric Powder - ½ teaspoon | Red Chili Powder - ½ teaspoon | Salt - As you want | Cooking Oil - As you want

title: Simple Bitter Gourd Fry with Curd Sambol Recipe (KETO)
instructions: Rinse the bitter gourd and cut it into thin round pieces. Take off the middle part along with the seeds. Also, chop the onions, coriander leaves, and green chilies. Besides, take turmeric powder, curd, salt, and cooking oil. Add turmeric powder and salt to the bitter gourd. Mix those well until all are combined. Heat the oil and fry the bitter gourd pieces to a golden brown. For me, it takes about 10 minutes under high flame. Now take a large bowl and add onion, green chili, coriander leaves, curd, and salt. Mix them well. Finally, add fried bitter gourd pieces and mix everything till combined. This is how to make a simple bitter gourd fry with curd sambol recipe. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan healthy pavakkai or Karawila fried salad.
ingredients: Bitter Gourd - 400g | Onion - 150g | Green chili - 3 or 4 | Coriander leaves - As you want | Curd - 2 tablespoons | Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon | Salt - As you want (KETO people use the Himalayan Pink Salt) | Cooking oil - As you want (KETO people use the Organic Coconut Oil)
ingredients_per_person: Bitter Gourd - 100g | Onion - 37 1/2g | Green chili - 3/4 or 4 | Coriander leaves - As you want | Curd - 1/2 tablespoons | Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon | Salt - As you want (KETO people use the Himalayan Pink Salt) | Cooking oil - As you want (KETO people use the Organic Coconut Oil)

title: Ash Gourd Curry Recipe (Puhul/Wax Gourd/Winter Melon)
instructions: Take the ash gourd, peel off its skin, and cut off the part of the seed. Rinse and cut it into medium-sized pieces. Besides, cut the onion, green chilies, and dried red chilies. Additionally, prepare the coconut milk and take some water. Also, prepare with curry leaves, turmeric powder, salt, mustard seeds, and cooking oil. Now, place the skillet on the stove and add the ash gourd. On top of that, add green chili, ¼ parts of the onion, turmeric powder, salt, and water. Give a good mix. Cook covered under a high flame until all the liquid evaporates. Halfway through, take off the lid and give a good stir. For, me it takes about 10 minutes. Now, add coconut milk and give a mix. Cook covered under medium flame for about three minutes. Adjust salt if needed. Once done, switch off the flame and leave it aside for final preparation. Heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter. Then, add the rest of the onion, curry leaves, and dried red chili. Sauté them until the onion turns golden. Finally, add the prepared ash gourd curry, give a gentle mix, and switch off the flame. This is how to cook the best and most tasty ash gourd curry recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan Puhul curry recipe.
ingredients: Ash gourd/Winter melon - 500g (Before cleaning) | Onion - 75g | Green chili - 3 or 4 | Dried red chili - 1 or 2 | Curry leaves - Few | Thick coconut milk - 100ml | Mustard seeds - ¼ teaspoon | Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon | Water - 150ml | Salt - As you want | Cooking oil - As you need
ingredients_per_person: Ash gourd/Winter melon - 166 2/3g (Before cleaning) | Onion - 25g | Green chili - 1 or 4 | Dried red chili - 1/3 or 2 | Curry leaves - Few | Thick coconut milk - 33 1/3ml | Mustard seeds - ¼ teaspoon | Turmeric powder - ¼ teaspoon | Water - 50ml | Salt - As you want | Cooking oil - As you need
